projectsummary.description: Including: time track, request management, customized reports (based to iReport), customized KPIs, dashboard gadgets, knowledge base, risk management, costs and budget management, agile board, resource capacity, surveys, SVN integration, and Gantt chart. The tool also includes: extendable agents (email notification, audit agents, etc), meta fields and custom forms.
projectsummary.registration_description:
This project must be implemented using the Java, JSP ans Struts. For the tests the database choosed, was the MySQL, but the focus is to use the standards data base statements in order to keep the system "almost" free of data base vendors. The use of free tag-libs in order to show the form tables into GUI is considered too.
The mission of this project is to build a web-based tool of Project Management, following the best practices of Software Engeneering. Nowadays the small companies (specially) has critic problems to manage the life-cicle of the products they made. There is some tools used (like MSProject) but is hard to find a tool free and that contain some desired funcionalities like: - Gantt diagram - Resource Capacity Graph (in order to plann the resources schedule) - Workflow integration (between manager and customer or managers and resources) - Requirement Management by customer or even managers in order to make a impact analisys (for example) - alerts of manage problems detected by system - History data base containing the problems solved before (bugs fixed, business rules changing details, etc) - Risc and Cost forms
This kind of features is the main road-map of this project.

newsitem.details: Na semana passada (09/02/2005) a pagina do projeto foi disponibilizada no endereço http://plandora.sourceforge.net/

newsitem.summary: Versão alpha liberada!! - Alpha Version Released!!
newsitem.details: Foi disponibilizado nesta semana a versão Alpha do PLANdora que cobre cerca de 30% dos requisitos planejados inicialmente. Embora seja um número que esteja aquém da meta, esta versão inclui uma série de outras funcionalidades que foram acrescentadas out-requirement, mas que foram consideradas importantes durante a utilização por parte da empresa que está auxiliando na maturação da ferramenta..
Liberada nova versão do software PLANdora. New release of PLANdora Project Management. Download It!

The new PLANdora version 0.8.9 was released and is avaialable for download.
A versão 0.8.9 da ferramenta PLANdora está disponível para download.

The PLANdora version was released. See bellow the main feature/bugs fixed of this new version:
=> bug fix - Requirement form validation method. Problem with null pointer after 'self-requirement' without a suggested date. - Forms of 'All requirements' and 'All Tasks' displaying resources/customers wronglly - If allocation form, the resource combo was displaying the user of current project and (wronglly) the child projects. - Some messages/labels of table taglib weren't in i18N. - After task closing they still had been displayed into main form (even the task had been closed more than 1 week).
=> features - Creation of priority option 'to be defined' for requirements - Now the leader is able to disable a leader/resource/customer to participate specific project. - Implementation of support for english language en-US and spanish es-EN - Colored bullets into grids of task screen in order to show the current status of task - The field username was enlarge to 30 characters - Implementation of preferences to set the number of cells words of name/descriptions of grids (default value = 20) - Now the task status combo is dinamically, according with the task state machine. Now the combo display only the allowed
status. - The grids of main form and requirement form are ordered now - Into the main form was implemented anchors to improve the navegability - Implementation of 'changing password' feature into preferences screen. - The password is stored into data base with criptografy in order to keep the user privacy. - Implementation into Gantt of 'redim bar' of left lateral box - Implementation of SAVE button into Gantt and the infra-structure to update the tasks upon the Gantt (only for moving/redim
of Jobs and edition of task capacity) - Implementation of feature of configuring the max capacity for each resource for each project (default=480min) - configuring the max records to be displayed by "My Requirements" and "My Tasks" grids. (configurable by preferences screen) - For requirement list into main form, the requiments with reject/canceled and closed are displayed with red or green color. - Visual improving for history popups (requirements and task). Keep the same size independentlly of lines number and to allow the copy of history comments (before the content used to be displayed into msgbox...) - implementation of feature to allow/to forbid (default) a customer of specific project to see the technical comments of
project resource. - creation of Category form to be managed by user root (a category can be setted to specific project and be used for task or requirements) - a category field was inclued into requirment form - implementation of Meta Fields feature. The meta fields can be populated by root used and linked with a 'project' and 'one or any category'. When the customer open the requirement form, this 'field' is dinamically displayed into form like a native field. Is possible to create a metafield like a textBox, ComboBox (with static data) and SQLComboBox (with data comming from a SQL pre-defined) - For preferences screen of leader is possible to show/hide the fields of "All Requirements" form. This was implemented due to the great number of fields related on requirements (included Meta Fields). Now each leader can customize which fields he needs to view.
The new PLANdora web site was relesed. PLANdora is a tool to manage projects and control requirements and tasks. http://plandora.org/
The PLANdora team are pleased to present a number of demos about the main features of tool. http://plandora.sourceforge.net/presentation.htm

The new version of Plandora was released. Plandora is a tool for project, requirement and task management. Check the news about the tool accessing the project web-site: http://plandora.sourceforge.net/
See you!

forum_post.subject: RE: Project Repository - System DB - Delete Files
forum_post.body:
Hi cotonete, how are you?
The feature to remove files from SystemDB repository, was not implemented yet. Actually, it is importat to mention that, if you are planning store project files into a repository, I strongly recommend you to use a robust solution like SVN and integrating it on Plandora. I actually would use SystemDB repository only for specific purposes.
Anyway, to remove a file, you have to do directly in database. All files of SystemDB repository are stored such as BLOBs into Plandora Database.
Check please, the tables: "db_repository_item" that contain the reference of each file and "db_repository_version" that contain versions for each files.
I also recommend you take a look at Plandora database model. Can be useful when you start creating custom notification agents, reports and KPIs.
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: Intalling trouble when installing 1.7.0
forum_post.body:
Hi,
I've realized that there are a couple troubles in database creation script, for 1.7.0
1) It's required to previously create schema "plandora", otherwise, script doesn't know what to do
2) Root user has a different password than "null", i needed to clean inserted password. Installation steps says we must insert root user with no password.
3) there is a af.date_value exception when executing for the first time, i needed to manually add date_value field to aditional_field as DateTime (i don't know whether it's right or not, but it works now)
Thanks for such a wonderful tool

forum_post.subject: RE: I could not able to connect the database
forum_post.body:
Hi Jeypee, in fact, we've found an error that maybe is causing the problem that you've reported. The problem is related with the default password validation.
The problem will be fixed in the next Plandora release (v1.7.0). But I'm describing bellow a workaround procedure, for v1.6.0:
After install Plandora (v1.6.0) and start the Tomcat: 1) go to folder <YOUR_TOMCAT>\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\com\pandora\bus\
2) make a backup of current "UserBUS.class" file
3) copy the file that is available here: "http://plandora.sourceforge.net/patches/UserBUS.class" to this folder and restart Tomcat.
4) try to perform the login with the user 'root' and password '123'
5) probably the problem will still remain, but now, check the tomcat log. It will be something like that:
24, sep 2009 09:38:10 com.pandora.helper.LogUtil log INFO: [root] [QL0AFWMIX8NRZTI/oT9cXsvbvu8=] 24, sep 2009 09:38:10 com.pandora.helper.LogUtil log INFO: [root] authentication failed.
6) get the text between brackts and perform the sql bellow:
update tool_user set password='QL0AFWMIX8NRZTI/oT9cXsvbvu8=' where username='root';
7) copy back the backup file "UserBUS.class" and try the login again
I don't know if this procedure will solve your problem, but this is a stupid bug :-(
Probably in the next release, the root default password will be blank, instead '123'.
I hope to help you. Regards,
Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: I could not able to connect the database
forum_post.body:
Hi Jeypee, did you got access using the user root and the default password: "123"?
Notice that, the user/password that must be used at login form is not the user/password that you have used during the configuration of Tomcat data source (context.xml).
Thank you to use the Plandora tool!
Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: suppression of project
forum_post.body:
Hi Regis, the request can be canceled as following:
1) by customer role: only if the customer that is the requester and only if the request is "waiting approve". 2) by leader role: the leader can reject the request only if the request is "waiting approve" status and the user is a leader of the request project.
If the request was accepted by the leader, probably is because, there are tasks related to this request. Thus, the request can NOT be cancelled at all. In this case:
1) all tasks must be worked and closed, in order to close the request automatically. 2) or, the tasks must be cancelled by leader (at form "Show All Tasks"). After that, the request will be changed to "waiting aprove" status again.
Regards.

Hi rbaudu7 how are you?
A project can be "closed" only by the leader. But, the system will check if the project contain opened tasks, requests, etc. After closing, the project will be hidden for team but not removed from data base.
The requests can be canceled by the request owner or rejected by leader.
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: Problems with planning
forum_post.body:
Hi Castillom, how are you.
You are correct. The fact is, when you change the status to "in-progress", Plandora sum up all time of "planned" slots and store this information into the Task, because the slots distribution will be used to store the "actual time".
I agree that is not a good idea, specially because it lost a precious information that could be used to make comparisons between "planned" and "actual time", bucket by bucket. For while, you have only a lista of snapshots (thru the task history form) and the total time planned.
This issue will be probably solved in the next releases. You are not the first person that tell us about that. Believe me :-(
Thank you

forum_post.subject: RE: create more than one root user
forum_post.body: Hi rogermoa! The root user can not be replicated. If you have more than one user that could manage the system with adminstrator privilages, they have to share the same root user/pass. The roadmap of project contain an idea to improve the user control of Plandora allowing the configuration of custom user profiles. But, honestly, I dont think it will be feasible in a short term. Sorry.:-( Thank you.

forum_post.subject: Fedora 15 instalation (SOLVED)
forum_post.body:
We've received a contact from somebody in Swiss that was facing some problems to install Plandora (Tomcat) at Fedora 15. The solution is below. The Plandora installation page was updated:
[i]"Hi, I was struggling with the installation of Plandora under fedora 15. The fedora tomcat packages (tomcat-7.0.23-1.fc15.noarch, ....).
I got the error: javax.naming.NamingException: Could not create resource factory instance [Root exception is java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.BasicDataSourceFactory]
==> the package .../tomcat/lib/tomcat-dbcp.jar was missing. (thanks to: http://forums.opensuse.org/english/other-forums/development/programming-scripting/389317-basicdatasourcefactory-class-not-found-tomcat.html)
I found the missing package in the installation zip from http://tomcat.apache.org/download-70.cgi, extracted it and placed it into .../tomcat/lib. Restarted tomcat This would be a nice hint in: http://www.plandora.org/project.htm many thanks"[/i]

forum_post.subject: RE: Gantt contains wrong dates
forum_post.body:
Hi Magnus, how are you?
1) "calendar.format" is one of the itens of Plandora resource file. If you've deployed Plandora, you probably noticed some files with prefix "ApplicationResources" at folder below. Each file contain the phrases and words for each available language. [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\
2) The previous discussion starts when the Chinese and Russian guys were trying to migrate Plandora to an asian language. We discovered that, we need to perform some adjustments, such as: (a) create a new resource file (b) change the values of keys "calendar.format" and "encoding" from the new "resource file" (c) change (eventually) the encoding of [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\jsp\encoding.jsp
3) regarding the Gantt chart, the Chinese guy told me that, due to the Gantt GUI was an applet, it was necessary to recompile the gantt.jar code with a specific font. In that case, he recompiled the Gantt source code with a Chinese font instead Arial.
I hope help you.
Cheers!

forum_post.body:
Hi Albertopereto.
I'm experiencing the same bug and have questions regarding the workaround. What exactly do you mean by calendar.format of resource file? How do I change this so plandora's gantt chart works (from a user perspective)?

forum_post.subject: RE: Problems with install / login
forum_post.body:
hi Mike, how are you?
If you've seen the login page, means that the deployment (war file) was OK. Your problem seems to be with Mysql driver. The Tomcat is not able to find the driver (connectorJ) yet.
Are you sure you have to place the context file at webapps/ROOT/META-INF ? I'm not able to reproduce your enviroment (Ubuntu) but normally, this file must be placed at Tomcat /conf folder. Did you tried this?
See below some references that can be useful:
https://sourceforge.net/projects/plandora/forums/forum/396145/topic/1913347
https://sourceforge.net/projects/plandora/forums/forum/396145/topic/4499774
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: LDAP Authentication settings
forum_post.body:
Hi Regis, how are you?
Plandora really has LDAP authentication. We are currently using this feature successfully in our company. So, it really works. :-)
The uid posted by you, seems to be OK. In our company we are using something like that: uid=<USER>,ou=Usuarios,dc=ourcompanyname,dc=com,dc=br
My concern is about your LDAP server. You says that your LDAP server does not receive any connect request.
1) Are you sure didn't you have any connectivity issue? Plandora web server can reach the IP of LDAP server? 2) When you are trying to login, which message error is displayed by Plandora? Did you notice some error message at Tomcat log file?
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: LDAP Authentication settings
forum_post.body: we are testing some project management tools and the LDAP authentication is key for us. is LDAP authentication supported? if yes, how? thanks Best regards Regis

then, we load "http://ourhost/pandora/do/login?operation=prepareLogin" and use an ldap login account but nothing happens: in particular, our ldap server does not receive any connect request.
is there something else to do? thanks regis

forum_post.subject: RE: Migration.
forum_post.body: The grids of new version was changed to ajax functions. Probably the javascript of old version is still in the cache of your browser. Try: (1) press F5 at Plandora main form (2) or try to clean the browse cache (3) or try to access Plandora using a machine/ browser that has never accessed Plandora before. I saw this issue once , and I made one of those procedures and to me worked.

forum_post.subject: RE: IO error when modifying a project
forum_post.body:
Hi Moises, how are you?
"Feltraco" is right, this bug is quite easy to solve. All you have to do is go to Options Form (with Plandora root user) and find the property that contain the path of Lucene file system. The default value is an arbitrary path for Windows environment. Then, you should change this field to a Linux path, for example: /usr/share/plandora_kb/
My best regards.

forum_post.subject: RE: IO error when modifying a project
forum_post.body:
Pessoal, estava com o mesmo problema e resolvi da seguinte forma. Crie um registro para cada usuario na tabela: preferences setando os valores:
USER_ID = ID DO USUARIO ID = kb.index.folder VALUE = "PASTA DE DESTINO"
Certifique-se da pasta de destino ter permissao de escrita.
Isso eh necessario pq na classe: PreferenceTO ele seta como default c:\index if(key.equals("kb.index.folder")) response = "c:\\index\\";
Abraco espero que ajude.

forum_post.subject: RE: Reopen task
forum_post.body:
Hi Javier, how are you?
About the tasks, once closed, it cannot be reoped anymore. Anyway, even closed, you could feed the tasks with more comments if you want.
Meantime, if the task was created under a workflow of Plandora, it could be eventually reopened. But this event will depend the context of the workflow. For example for tasks opened/reopened after a decision point of workflow.
thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: Document Repository
forum_post.body:
Hi rekhak how are you?
The button "New Artifact" at Repository Form opens this form that you have mention. This popup, is opened to able user to choose what kind of "document template" the user want to use. It can be used to create colaborative documents for your project (something like a WIKI document). The templates could be changed or created freely, but unfortunately (until version 1.10.4) there is no "good-looking GUI" to perform this. The changes must be done directly at table artifact_template (including the "blank template").
The button "Upload File" you can use to put a file from your computer inside the project repository (like a repository "commit" feature). Its important to mention that, for while (until version 1.10.4) the "Upload file" button is shown only for DB Repository mode. If your project was configurated to use a SVN repository, this button will be hidden. We are working to implement this feature soon.
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: potential issue under plandora 1.10
forum_post.body:
Hi sskraft, how are you?
I think the index files are corrupted. Have you tried to clean it? Please, go to Options Form of root user (System Administrator Options) and press the button: "Reset Index". Plandora will create all indexes again in background. Depending the number of tasks, requests, risks, etc of your data base, this process will take some time.
I hope can help you.
My best regards,
Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: Plandora evaluation - documentation needed
forum_post.body:
Hi Eric, about the questions 1 and 3 I've written a text explaining more about the relationship among entities .
http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/plandora/index.php?title=HowToOrganizeEntitiesHierarchically
About the question 2, there are the "All Tasks Form", Reports, Gadgts and the Gantt Chart that can be used by project leader to manage the time sheet. There are some native Reports, but they are all customizables, then it is possible to build a report that fit with your specific needs. The link bellow shows how to build a custom report.

Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: customize user form
forum_post.body:
Hi arnaud4dsp, how are you?
I don't know if I understand your question, but, in Plandora you are able to create new custom forms. To do this, you should create new records at Meta Form and Meta Field Form (using a root user).
The link below explain better the concept: http://www.plandora.org/presentation/fluxoConfiguracao-MetaForm.htm
In the other hand, if you want create new records at Department, Area or Function, all you have to do is to insert new lines there. This entities are auxiliary tables at Plandora DB, not a Meta Form.
I hope help you!

forum_post.subject: RE: potential issue under plandora 1.10
forum_post.body:
Hi machterka, how are you?
When you install Plandora, the default path of Knowledge Base index repository is "c:\index". I know, I know, it is a stupid idea to set a Window's path such as default setup ;-). But it is very easy to update the correct path.
All that you have to do is: (a) to sign-on at Plandora using the root user (2) click at "Options" link. (3) At Options form, there is a option called "Knowledge Base Index Files Folder", change it to a linux path, for example: "/usr/share/tomcat/kb_index/". (4) Make sure that this folder has Read and Write permissions. Plandora (thru Lucene) will use it to save the files of KB indexes.
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: Gantt contains wrong dates
forum_post.body:
Hi everyone!
After few months and a great patience of some guys (thanks to maxrozenson and Andrea), we've found the bug. This bug is related to the presentation layer only (the database layer is OK).
We discovered that Plandora is not able to handle calendar dates using textual month, for example masks like dd/MMMM/yyyy.
We opened a new issue (#3280037) and for while, the workaround is to keep the property "calendar.format" of Resource File with value "dd/MM/yyyy" or "MM/dd/yyyy".
Thank you very much.

forum_post.subject: RE: Ireport Version used in Plandora
forum_post.body:
Hello my friend.
Currently (version 1.10.x of Plandora) we are using the version 3.7.0 of iReport.
By the way, in the next Plandora version (probably will be release in May, 2011) we are planning to use the version 4.0 of iReport.
Thank you!

forum_post.subject: RE: Jboss4.2.2 and DataAccessException
forum_post.body:
Finally I could able to resolve the error.
The fix is you need to set <use-java-context> to false in mysql-ds.xml.
>>> Ex <<< <use-java-context>false</use-java-context> >>>
Without this jndi binding is happening in "java" namespace (which is the default behaviour) and thus resulting in improper bind location.
Hope this helps someone.

forum_post.subject: RE: installation
forum_post.body:
Hi, how are you?
You are not ignorant :-) In fact, Plandora don't contain any exe file. It is because, it is a client/server web application. It means that you should install the application into a webserver (for example a Tomcat server) and to setup the application into a data base (for example MySQL or PostgreSQL). After that, Plandora will be accessible not only by you, but everybody that have permission to access the webserver. This kind of architecture is tipical for small teams or companies that wants to implement a tool that help them to improve the team tasks.
If you want a tool only for you, to organize your tasks, etc, I suggest a standalone tool like Gantt Project (http://www.ganttproject.biz/) or Open Proj (http://openproj.org/openproj).
Anyway, feel free to test the online version of Plandora at http://plandora.sourceforge.net/online.htm
Thank you!
Alberto Pereto

This seems to be a common issue with RPM based installs. I seemingly fixed mine by simply adding:
JAVA_OPTS="-Djavax.sql.DataSource.Factory=org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSourceFactory"
to the end of the /etc/tomcat5/tomcat5.conf file and restarting tomcat5, service tomcat5 restart.

forum_post.subject: RE: Cyrillic symbols
forum_post.body:
Fixed it. If you want cyr symbols to be shown in your Plandora, you should: 1.set correct encoding parameters in jsps:
<%@ page contentType="text/html;charset=UTF-8" language="java" pageEncoding="UTF-8" %> <% request.setCharacterEncoding("UTF-8"); %> <% response.setCharacterEncoding("UTF-8"); %>
this should be placed definitly in header.jsp, but there are jsps (less of them), in wich this file is not included. Place parameters in such jsps separately. 2. set encoding parameters (URIEncoding="UTF-8" useBodyEncodingForURI="true") for tomcat connector (tag "connector" in server.xml); 3. to ensure having correct encoding in communication between mysql and tomcat, add encoding parameters (useUnicode, characterEncoding, etc) in mysql connection string (resource parameters in context.xml)

forum_post.subject: RE: Changing culture/language
forum_post.body:
Hi Nadev, I would like to thank your words. I feel happy Plandora can help your work.
About your question, Plandora uses the "resource file" feature to manage the internationalization. The labels language that display into client GUI depends on the configuration of client browser. This is out of control of Plandora.
When you deploy the Plandora into Tomcat, there are tree files localized at path bellow, that contain the i18n convertion:
[YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\
But, if you want to force a language, regardless any other, one way to bypass this problem is to remove the en-US file and pt-BR file and rename the spanish file (ApplicationResources_es.properties) to ApplicationResources.properties
I did't test this procedure yet, but I think it works.
Regards,
Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: Cannot log in
forum_post.body:
Hi Eric,
Yes, Plandora should work at Linux, but I've never tested it at Mandriva. I've seen Plandora working at Windows, RedHat, Slackware and Ubuntu. But I don't believe the problem that you reported is related with SO.
The problems seems to be with the relationship between Tomcat and MySQL (Plandora uses the connection pooling of Tomcat to access the database). So I have some questions:
1- Are you sure the 'user' and 'password' of MySQL was appropriately set into context.xml?
2- The MySQL and Tomcat are in different machines?
-> If yes, check if exists some connection issue between them.
-> If not, just in case, check the value of parameter "skip-networking" of your SO. I heard about some Linux version that this parameter is enabled and blocks other the access from other machines. See this link: http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-newbie-8/mysql-not-listening-on-port-3306-370210/
I hope to help you. Cheers, Alberto Pereto

forum_post.subject: RE: login
forum_post.body:
Hi everybody,
Mr. Gonzaga has solved his problem. He made contact with the Plandora support e-mail and report the following:
Firstly, he saw an error message that appeared in Plandora login form with a message: "Cannot create JDBC driver of class '' for connect URL 'null'"
Normally, this kind of message error occurs when the JNI settings of Tomcat it's not working appropriately. Plandora, uses the JNI facilities through Tomcat DataSource to access the data base.
There is a very useful link that explain the typical root causes for this problem: http://geeklondon.com/blog/view/tipnulljdbc
In addition of this site, the Plandora team recomends to check : - If the file mysql-connector-java-3.1.7-bin.jar is placed into the folder common/lib/ of Tomcat - to keep in mind that there are different configurations of data sources between Tomcat 5.0.x and 5.5.x. Read the Plandora installation process for more information: http://plandora.sourceforge.net/project.htm
In the case of Mr.Gonzaga, all this things was done appropriately but the problem was persisting. Then, he re-installed the Tomcat and repeat all this steps. Now it working.

forum_post.subject: RE: Problem with login
forum_post.body:
Hi oezike, how are you? Now the problem is little bit different, but is quite easy to solve. Now you should edit the 'server.xml' with the information about user and password that you've configurated when you've installed the MySQL.
The 'server.xml' from Plandora installation package, brings a generic user: YOUR_USER and YOUR_PASSWORD, but you have to change this parameters with the appropriate values according to your installation. If you did't configurate any user or password into MySQL, set the both fields with ("").
This procedures is necessary independently of MySQL version.
Danke!

forum_post.subject: RE: Problem with login
forum_post.body:
Hi oezike, how are you?
The version 5.0.28 of Tomcat must be OK with Plandora.
Are you sure that you overwrite the 'server.xml' (from Plandora installation package) into the Tomcat 'conf/' folder? This kind of problem normally happens if you don't configurate the 'connection pool' into Tomcat. The 'server.xml' from Plandora installation package contain the appropriate configuration for this.
Check this, and tell me what happen.
Thank you!
Obs.: In addition, I've noticed through the error message "???de_DE.error.authentication???" that you are in Germany (probably). Unfortunately, Plandora don't has traslation to German... :-( But, click in the post bellow to learn how to use one of the available languages: https://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=2003163&forum_id=396145

forum_post.subject: Problem with login
RE: label
forum_post.body:
Hi ssara,
unfortunately Plandora don't has translation to French. So you have to choose among: pt-BR (Brasil Portuguese), es (generic Spanish) or en-US (US English).
Then, go to the folder [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\ and replace the name of one of those ApplicationResources-xx-XX.properties files to ApplicationResources.properties.
In summary, an ApplicationResource without locale (at the name of file) will be interpretated by Tomcat such a default language.
merci!

Hi Javier, congratulations! It is very important to us, to know that there are people that are sharing the knowledge with the community. About the check-out, I've put into website a little tutorial teaching how to make it.
http://plandora.sourceforge.net/faqs/developers.htm
Try to perform those steps and let me know the difficulties or error messages. Thank you very much!

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body:
Based on bug (http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=14609) I changed all decimal types to float and that did the trick! Plandora is up and running on Mysql 5.0.45 and Tomcat 5.5.25 (the same context file should work on 6.0)
If I get access I'll be more than happy of commiting changes.

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body: BTW that gets Plandora up and running on Tomcat 5.0.45 and MySQL 4.1

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body: Check the Server Changes section here (http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/upgrading-from-4-1.html) to see if some of the changes affect your application. I'll check the script for any weird looking part.

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body: Tested with MySQL 4.1 and worked correctly. I'll check google to see if I can find related possible issues.

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body:
No haven't checked with the previous version. I'm downloading right now in order to test.
I'll verify what I did checkout. BTW I'm not really used to CVS (more used to SVN) but I didn't saw the tags folder.

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body:
Hi Javier, I have some questions to you:
1- About the DB problem: Did you make a test with the version 4.1 of MySQL in order to check if the error occurrs with a previous version?
2- About the project check-out: Could you explain with more details what did you do, to check-out the project? Because, it is not necessary to check-out any other module. The only point that you should focus is, if you want to test the correct version of Plandora, you should check-out the tag 'v1-0-0', instead the 'HEAD' (CVSROOT). Anyway, a freeze version of 'v1-0-0' is available into the installation package (plandora-source-1.0.0.zip)
For while, I will get MySQL 5.0.45 in order to try to reproduce the error that you report.
Thanks!

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body:
Have made some progress but now I'm getting a new error and Tomcat logs are empty so I can't track it down.
What I've done?
1. Introduced a context.xml file with DB information (the way Tomcat 5.3.X + works now) 2. Added some common libraries to pandora's lib folder (yes The project is named Plandora but the projects deploys as pandora)
The new error:
User or Password is wrong. java.sql.SQLException: Unknown type '246 in column 19 of 20 in binary-encoded result set.
This is obviously a DB related issue, since I'm working on MySQL 5.0.45 and you tested with version 4.x, but I'll need to step into the code in order to track it down. I checked out the project, I think, but can find files needed for a web project like WEB-INF in the CVS tree.
Which module I need to checkout to have what I need?
Thanks!

forum_post.subject: RE: Can't login
forum_post.body: BTW the connection info is correct since I can connect from other tools without problems...

forum_post.subject: Can't login
forum_post.body:
Followed the stepts described in the read me but still can't log in. I get this error:
User or Password is wrong. org.apache.tomcat.dbcp.dbcp.SQLNestedException: Cannot create JDBC driver of class '' for connect URL 'null'
Based on that it seems that the data source is not correctly set. I've tried copying the server.xml file and using the Tomcat Server Administration (version 5.5.25) tool with the following info:
JNDI Name: jdbc/plandora Data Source URL: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3307/plandora jdbc:mysql://localhost:3307/plandora JDBC Driver Class: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver User Name:**** Password:**** Max. Active Connections: 20 Max. Idle Connections: 10 Max. Wait for Connection: 200 Validation Query: select * from root;
And no luck.
Any idea?

tracker_item.summary: validacao da duracao de uma tarefa
tracker_item.details: Na validacao de duracao, esta deixando entrar 4h ao inves de 4.

followup.details:
Logged In: YES user_id=1095173
Foi colocado o label para que o usuario saiba que a unidade a ser entrada são "h". Alem disso o proprio formulario ignora caracteres alpha que estão junto do numero. Ou seja, se mesmo assim o usuario escrever 1h dentro da caixa de texto o sistema irá considerar apenas o numero "1".

tracker_item.details: Colocar como default da dataSugerida a data corrente

followup.details:
Logged In: YES user_id=1095173
A data sugerida na tela de solicitação nao contem data default (por exemplo a data corrente) para não influenciar o cliente a sugerir uma data que talvez nao fosse necessaria. A data sugerida está em branco para que apenas os clientes que queiram sugerir datas o façam. Assim, o lider nao recebe ruido de solicitações nao urgentes no momento da alocação.

tracker_item.summary: Problemas com substituicao de usuario alocado
tracker_item.details: Ao substituir um usuario alocado para uma tarefa por outro usuario, dá um erro de NullPointer

followup.details:
Logged In: YES user_id=1095173
Na substituicao de usuarios da lista de recursos alocados para a tarefa, o objeto ResourceTask estava sendo criado e carregado da base indevidamente. Isso tornava o objeto null e por isso o problema.

tracker_item.details: A ferrament nao está permitindo criar macro-tarefas, isto é, tarefas que nao possui nenhum recurso relacionado.

followup.details:
Logged In: YES user_id=1095173
O problema era algo ridiculo. Uma tarefa possui um atributo Vector que serve pra guardar um ou mais objetos ResourceTaskTO. A ferramenta estava permitindo tarefas sem ResourceTask relacionados mas estava fazendo a verificação do tipo: is Null, a questão era que o Vector nao era null mas tinha 0 elementos dentro. Acabava ocorrendo um erro logo depois. Faltava validar tmb se o size() era 0.

tracker_item.summary: valor default de tempo_efetivo nao deve ser 0
tracker_item.details: O valor default de tempo efetivo deve ser " " (branco) e não "0". O que está ocorrendo é que os recursos estão fechando a tarefa sem atualizar este campo, e como ele está com valor 0, o validador do form não reclama. Não pode ser validado o valor 0 porque o valor 0 é um valor valido. Então se o valor default for em branco e o recurso tentar fechar a tarefa, o validador reclamará a ausencia, e isso aumenta a chance do recurso ir até o campo e pensar num valor coerente.

Logged In: YES user_id=1095173

I'm not sure if I understood your problem but, the state machine of the requirement entity don't have any kind of human interation. Its states is always changed after a signficant modification of state machine of the task or tasks related to the requirement. For example, when a new task is created aggregated to the requirement the system changes the requirement status to 'Planning' or when the first task starts, the state of requirement is automatically changed to 'in-progress', and so on... tracker_item.summary: Problems to save tasks into Gantt
tracker_item.details: During the saving process into plandora gantt chart, the system shows the message "A error occurrs and the tasks cannot be saved."

followup.details:
The bug occurs at version 1.6.0 and 1.7.0 and is related to the authentication processo of Gantt Chart before saving process. The bug will be fixed at release 1.8.0.
The following steps, describe a workaround to solve the problem until next release: 1. Stop your Tomcat
2. Make a backup of file bellow: [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\com\pandora\bus\ConnectorBUS.class
3. Download the file below and replace it: http://plandora.sourceforge.net/patches/ConnectorBUS.class
4. Restart the Tomcat and try to save tasks using the Gantt Chart.
If the problem is still remaining, restore the backup file and make contact through the Plandora support e-mail.

OK, now it´s saving correctly. I applied the patch submitted and it worked.
Thank you.
Soon I'll fill in the survey

tracker_item.summary: Plandora doesn't work ok with https
tracker_item.details:
Hello, I have installed plandora in a tomcat with https, and some things of the application don't work ok, for example the mindmap.
Examining the execution of mindmap, I have realised that some internal requests are created putting "https://" no matter of the configured one.
I think there are at least these places with that problem:
./java/com/pandora/gui/struts/action/RepositoryFileViewerAction.java: frm.setServerURI("http://" + SessionUtil.getUri(request) + uri + "/showRepositoryViewerCustomer?operation=showViewerOutput&projectId=" + ./java/com/pandora/gui/struts/action/RepositoryFileViewerAction.java: frm.setServerURI("http://" + SessionUtil.getUri(request) + uri + "/showRepositoryViewerCustomer?projectId=" + ./java/com/pandora/gui/struts/action/GanttViewerAction.java: gvfrm.setServerURI("http://" + hst + prt + uri + "/connectorListener"); ./java/com/pandora/gui/struts/action/MindMapAction.java: frm.setServerURI("http://" + SessionUtil.getUri(request) + uri + "?operation=loadMindMap&entityid=" + rootId);
If it is difficult to guess the protocol, it would be appreciated to be possible to define it in a file, to avoid recompiling the java source.
Many thanks!

followup.details: This bug was identified and has just been fixed in development version. Thank you "anonymous contributor" your feedback!
this bug was solved since version 1.11.0

tracker_item.details:
The interface itself is well Russified, we have trouble with the Russian language: Create a category in Russian. See category.png It's okay. I looked on the list. See Spisok.png We can see that is not displayed correctly.
How can I fix it?
After creating a macro task, there isn't any form that shows the macro task. So, the user is not able to edit or change the macro task attributes.

followup.details:
In fact there is a bug at version v1.11.0 that hides the macro task record from the user. The bug was fixed and will be available at next release (probably Q3-2012).
For while, it is necessary performing the procedure below:
0) stop the Tomcat and make a copy of file: [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\com\pandora\dao\TaskDAO.class
1) download the file attached at this issue.
2) replace the file attached (TaskDAO.class) into the folder [YOUR_TOMCAT]\webapps\pandora\WEB-INF\classes\com\pandora\dao\
3) start Tomcat again and check the Task Form. The macro task must be shown in bold and the sub-tasks must be shown in a tree structure (see the image attached in this issue)

followup.details:
Hi apmari how are you?
Apparently, the problem seems to be only with presentation layer. I think you do NOT need to rewrite all data again.
The column "Start" shows the creation date of table PROJECT. Do you remember exactly what table did you modified?
Thank you!

Ciao Alberto, i modified the status of the projects, from closed to open. Something like: mysql> update project set project_status_id=replace(project_status_id,'3','1') where name = "test alfano"; Thanks, apm

Hi,
I don't know if we found the real cause but the project with id="0" do not contain any status. This could be a problem eventually. The project with id="0" is a hidden project considered only internally by the tool. All projects are a child node (directly or indirectly) from this project. Then, it is important fix it using the sql below.
update project set project_status_id=1 where id=0;
Ciao.

Ciao Alberto, changing the status of the project id=0 gave good results. Now i can assign the dates with the correct values. Last issues are in the calendar application. As i attached in the file calendar, the arrow with incremen or decrement the monts, doesn't work, the double arrow for the years work. Last request, is possible to change the language from portugese to english? Thanks Alberto.

tracker_item.details: Ciao Alberto, i did the porting from 1.10.4 to 1.11.0 and i followed the istructions. Now not all the query are available on the mail form. I can authenticate, i can see the agent configured, but i can't see the users. Any suggestion?

Ciao Alberto, i finally set up your application in a real enviroment. My colleagues started today to use Plandora. I set up the 1.11.0. I found a little problem on the agent notification. I set up the notification of the new assigned task, it works but with an issue. If the leader, will assign two or more tasks in an interval ( i set up the minimum 10 minutes). The email is sent only to the first resource with received a task. In the email are included the assigned tast to other resources. Is there a way to solve this? Tell me if u need details. Regards, apm

followup.details:
Hi apmari how are you?
In order to send emails to multiples users, you have to set the flag "Send one e-mail only?" to "-" and set the field "Sender" with the value "#COL_n#" where "n" is the number of column of your SQL statement that contain the email address of the user.
The side effect of this feature is: if your SQL contain many lines (tasks in your case) for the same user, it will receive a bunch of emails. This "grouping" issue will be solved in the Plandora future version.
Thank you!
As always thank for your tempestive reply. apm

tracker_item.summary: Implmentação da Funcionalidade de Aceite de Cliente
tracker_item.details: - Projeto precisa ter atributo para definitir se é ou nao versionado - Na tela de projeto precisa existir um campo que define para cada recurso alocado no projeto, se o default do fechamento das solicitações abertas por este usuario será feito pelo Recurso Executador (quando fecha a tarefa) ou pelo proprio Cliente solicitante (atraves de aceite) - criação de mais dois estados: Aguardando Aceite (para solicitacao) e Implementado (para Tarefa) - Na tela de alocacao de tarefa o lider deverá ser capaz de alterar o status corrente de "aceite da solicitação" (isto é, quem é q vai fechar a solicitacao) - Criação de Manage Versions - Alterar tela de Solicitação para suportar estado de "Aguardando Aceite": (campo de comentario, botao de aceite/nao aceite, etc) - importante: auto-solicitação força o estado para fechamento normal pelo proprio executador (isto é, sem aceite)

tracker_item.summary: Desabilitar Usuario relacionado a um projeto
tracker_item.details: Seria interessante que na alocação de recursos para um projeto fosse possivel desabilitar um usuário. Isso faria com que este usuário bloqueado não visualizasse mais o projeto no combo de solicitações ou não pudesse ser mais utilizado para alocação de tarefas. Isso é interessante para os casos de recursos que estão temporariamente ou permanentemente fora do projeto, mas que é necessário mante-los relacionados ao projeto por motivos de histórico, mesmo porque, o sistema nem deixaria remover o relacionamento caso este recurso tivesse uma solicitação ou tarefa cadastrada no projeto.

tracker_item.details: Have you considered releasing this as JSR complaint portlets?

followup.details: Hi midirr, How are you? Plandora tool has a simillar concept that we calls Gadgets. These things are charts or tiny forms that can be used to compose a kind of dashboard. But unfortunately, it has a particular architecture that is similar to the JSR standard but it is not in compliance with portlets, yet... We really consider, in medium term, to release a version of Plandora to reach this compliance. Thank you!
